result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kody Dean Melstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kody Dean Melstrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kody Dean Melstrom was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Kody Dean Melstrom was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 3.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 3:00 pm January 22, 2019.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Diversion Coordinator to provide quarterly updates.
Court extends 10 business days to determine credit.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski   DF:  Kody Dean Melstrom appeared. Case called at 3:14. Includes 15CF453, 16CF119, 18CF381, 18CF597.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC  to Ct  1, 2, 4 in the amended information in 15CF453. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 2, 4  in  the amended information in 15CF453. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct. 3 in 15CF453, 18CF597, 18CF381 and 16CF119. Sentencing arguments. Crt signs DJOC. 

On Ct. 2
18 mo. probation with conditons:
- 60 days condition time STAYED. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
   Apply bond on file. 
- AODA and recommended follow through. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times .    This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- 20 hours of community service. 

On Ct. 4- same conditions as Ct. 2. 
 Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

Diversion coordinator to provide quarterly updates. 
DE to report to probation not later than 01-22-2019 before 3:00pm
Bond continues until DE reports to probation.
Court extends 10 business to determine credit. 
Court suspends testing until De reports to Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 18, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Basline test before release from jail.

Report every Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
